abstract: A college president, with a talented Marine reservist for a student, makes a case for changing the age limit for Rhodes Scholarships.
snippet: A college president, with a talented Marine reservist for a student, makes a case for changing the age limit for Rhodes Scholarships.
lead_paragraph: Mitchell B. Reiss, the president of Washington College, in Chestertown, Md., has started a one-man campaign to end what he sees as a lingering, unfair form of discrimination against veterans: the age limits on candidates for the prestigious Rhodes Scholarships, which pay for two years of graduate study at Oxford University.

headline.main: For Veterans, Age Is Rhodes Scholarship Obstacle
